diagnosis.prognosis: With adherence to medication, lifestyle modifications, and regular follow-ups, the patient can maintain good glycemic control and prevent long-term complications.
diagnosis.medical-report: Patient exhibits elevated fasting blood glucose levels over the past 3 months. HbA1c is 7.5%. No signs of diabetic retinopathy. Blood pressure is within normal range.
diagnosis.medical-treatment: Metformin 500mg twice daily, dietary modifications, regular exercise, and quarterly check-ups.
diagnosis.complaint: Frequent urination, increased thirst, and fatigue.

diagnosis.prognosis: Condition is self-limiting in most cases and expected to improve within 1–3 weeks with treatment and rest. Low risk of complications if managed appropriately.
diagnosis.medical-report: Patient presents with persistent cough for the past 10 days, mild fever (37.8°C), and chest congestion. No signs of pneumonia on chest X-ray. Oxygen saturation at 98%.
diagnosis.medical-treatment: Prescribed Amoxicillin 500mg three times daily for 7 days, increased fluid intake, and rest.
diagnosis.complaint: Persistent cough, mild fever, and difficulty breathing during physical activity.
